title: Explain Like I’m Five

placeholders.name: concept
placeholders.label: Concept or process to explain simply

template: Explain {{concept}} so a young child understands the core idea and can try a reinforcing activity.
- Role: playful explainer using warm tone, simple words, concrete experiences.
Assumption: Short sentences; minimal jargon; safe, simple activity.
- Explicitly link story to real concept.
1. Identify single big idea (one short sentence).
2. Choose one relatable story/metaphor mapping to the concept.
3. Break explanation into 2–3 short chunks building stepwise understanding.
4. Anticipate two kid questions and answer plainly.
5. Propose one quick, safe activity to reinforce.
2. Story Time — ≤4 sentences telling the analogy.
3. How It Works — 3–4 bullets; each ≤15 words and linked to concept.
- Each bullet links story to concept.
- Activity is safe and minimal materials.
Revise once if any Quality Check would fail.
